string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Copyright Module
Copyright in Online Education
No Fair Use Needed
Steps for Copyright Analysis
What are not protected by copyright? Select all that apply.
Works that spark creativity include:
You will likely need to rely on fair use.
To summarize the steps
Fair Use is a case-by-case assessment
What is Copyright?
Learning Objectives
How this course works
Facts or Myths?
Check your knowledge
Copyright Exceptions
When you don't need fair use
When you don't need fair use
When you don't need fair use
Which statement is NOT true regarding copyright?
An instructor can use up to 10 percent of the work without making a fair use determination or seeking permission from the copyright owner.
As long as I provide proper citation of a copyrighted work, I do not need to seek permission to use it.
Rearrange the steps for copyright analysis.

Professor P recorded a video for his online course about the upcoming Senate elections and includes an official photo taken by a government employee and four bills authored by the incumbent that Adam found on the Senate's website. He does not need to do fair use analysis for his use of the photo.

Professor M wants her students to watch an entire episode of "The Big Bang Theory" in her online class as a case study for social interaction. The episode is available commercially through a pay-for-video commercial service such as Amazon, Google Play, YouTube, for a nominal fee. Professor Moore must conduct fair use analysis for her use of the episode.
Which professor should have done a fair use analysis of their course material?
Which of the following resources are protected by copyright. Select all that apply.
Works in _____________ are not protected by copyright.

Professor B posts the first chapter of the required textbook for her online students to read for the first week of the semester while they wait for their copy of the textbook. Does she need to conduct fair use analysis?
Professor F copies a Shakespearian play, The Winters Tale, from a copyrighted anthology and post it in her British Literature online course. She does not need fair use analysis for this play.
Which work should NOT be considered for course materials based on their copyright status?
Professor A wants to play a 15-minute portion of the film Amadeus in his online music course. He conducted a fair use analysis and found it likely to be fair. What should he do next?
Match the descriptions with the terms.
Professor H found a journal article she wanted to use in her online class through the schools library. What is the best option for her?
Professor L wants to play a 15-minute portion of the film Amadeus in his online music course. He conducted a fair use analysis and ended up in a grey area. What should he do next?

Professor G wants play a clip from an episode of The Big Bang Theory in his online English course. He is aware of copyright protection and that students can rent the episode through a streaming service, but he only wants to show a few minutes of it. What should he do next?
The following works could be used as course materials. Which one must be assessed for fair use?
True or False: Providing citation is not legally required but it demonstrates ethical and responsible practices.
True or False: The Consumer Price Index report for April 2024 has just been published. You can use the report in its entirety without worrying about copyright.
What works are copyright-protected? Select all that apply.
Copyright video exerpt
Fair Use Basics
